The proverbs<S>4912</S> of Solomon<S>8010</S> the son<S>1121</S> of David<S>1732</S>, king<S>4428</S> of Israel<S>3478</S>;
To know<S>3045</S> wisdom<S>2451</S> and instruction<S>4148</S>; to perceive<S>995</S> the words<S>561</S> of understanding<S>998</S>;
To receive<S>3947</S> the instruction<S>4148</S> of wisdom<S>7919</S>, justice<S>6664</S>, and judgment<S>4941</S>, and equity<S>4339</S>; <sup>equity: Heb. equities</sup>
To give<S>5414</S> subtilty<S>6195</S> to the simple<S>6612</S>, to the young man<S>5288</S> knowledge<S>1847</S> and discretion<S>4209</S>. <sup>discretion: or, advisement</sup>
A wise<S>2450</S> man will hear<S>8085</S>, and will increase<S>3254</S> learning<S>3948</S>; and a man of understanding<S>995</S> shall attain<S>7069</S> unto wise counsels<S>8458</S>:
To understand<S>995</S> a proverb<S>4912</S>, and the interpretation<S>4426</S>; the words<S>1697</S> of the wise<S>2450</S>, and their dark sayings<S>2420</S>. <sup>the interpretation: or, an eloquent speech</sup>
The fear<S>3374</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S> is the beginning<S>7225</S> of knowledge<S>1847</S>: but fools<S>191</S> despise<S>936</S> wisdom<S>2451</S> and instruction<S>4148</S>. <sup>the beginning: or, the principal part</sup>
My son<S>1121</S>, hear<S>8085</S> the instruction<S>4148</S> of thy father<S>1</S>, and forsake<S>5203</S> not the law<S>8451</S> of thy mother<S>517</S>:
For they shall be an ornament<S>3880</S> of grace<S>2580</S> unto thy head<S>7218</S>, and chains<S>6060</S> about thy neck<S>1621</S>. <sup>an: Heb. an adding</sup>
My son<S>1121</S>, if sinners<S>2400</S> entice<S>6601</S> thee, consent<S>14</S> thou not.
If they say<S>559</S>, Come<S>3212</S> with us, let us lay wait<S>693</S> for blood<S>1818</S>, let us lurk<S>6845</S> privily for the innocent<S>5355</S> without cause<S>2600</S>:
Let us swallow them up<S>1104</S> alive<S>2416</S> as the grave<S>7585</S>; and whole<S>8549</S>, as those that go down<S>3381</S> into the pit<S>953</S>:
We shall find<S>4672</S> all precious<S>3368</S> substance<S>1952</S>, we shall fill<S>4390</S> our houses<S>1004</S> with spoil<S>7998</S>:
Cast<S>5307</S> in thy lot<S>1486</S> among<S>8432</S> us; let us all have one<S>259</S> purse<S>3599</S>:
My son<S>1121</S>, walk<S>3212</S> not thou in the way<S>1870</S> with them; refrain<S>4513</S> thy foot<S>7272</S> from their path<S>5410</S>:
For their feet<S>7272</S> run<S>7323</S> to evil<S>7451</S>, and make haste<S>4116</S> to shed<S>8210</S> blood<S>1818</S>.
Surely in vain<S>2600</S> the net<S>7568</S> is spread<S>2219</S> in the sight<S>5869</S> of any bird<S>1167</S> <S>3671</S>. <sup>in the: Heb. in the eyes of every thing that hath a wing</sup>
And they lay wait<S>693</S> for their own blood<S>1818</S>; they lurk privily<S>6845</S> for their own lives<S>5315</S>.
So are the ways<S>734</S> of every one that is greedy<S>1214</S> of gain<S>1215</S>; which taketh away<S>3947</S> the life<S>5315</S> of the owners<S>1167</S> thereof.
Wisdom<S>2454</S> crieth<S>7442</S> without<S>2351</S>; she uttereth<S>5414</S> her voice<S>6963</S> in the streets<S>7339</S>: <sup>Wisdom: Heb. Wisdoms, that is, Excellent wisdom</sup>
She crieth<S>7121</S> in the chief place<S>7218</S> of concourse<S>1993</S>, in the openings<S>6607</S> of the gates<S>8179</S>: in the city<S>5892</S> she uttereth<S>559</S> her words<S>561</S>, saying,
How long, ye simple ones<S>6612</S>, will ye love<S>157</S> simplicity<S>6612</S>? and the scorners<S>3887</S> delight<S>2530</S> in their scorning<S>3944</S>, and fools<S>3684</S> hate<S>8130</S> knowledge<S>1847</S>?
Turn<S>7725</S> you at my reproof<S>8433</S>: behold, I will pour out<S>5042</S> my spirit<S>7307</S> unto you, I will make known<S>3045</S> my words<S>1697</S> unto you.
Because I have called<S>7121</S>, and ye refused<S>3985</S>; I have stretched out<S>5186</S> my hand<S>3027</S>, and no man regarded<S>7181</S>;
But ye have set at nought<S>6544</S> all my counsel<S>6098</S>, and would<S>14</S> none of my reproof<S>8433</S>:
I also will laugh<S>7832</S> at your calamity<S>343</S>; I will mock<S>3932</S> when your fear<S>6343</S> cometh<S>935</S>;
When your fear<S>6343</S> cometh<S>935</S> as desolation<S>7722</S> <S>7584</S>, and your destruction<S>343</S> cometh<S>857</S> as a whirlwind<S>5492</S>; when distress<S>6869</S> and anguish<S>6695</S> cometh<S>935</S> upon you.
Then shall they call<S>7121</S> upon me, but I will not answer<S>6030</S>; they shall seek me early<S>7836</S>, but they shall not find<S>4672</S> me:
For that they hated<S>8130</S> knowledge<S>1847</S>, and did not choose<S>977</S> the fear<S>3374</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S>:
They would<S>14</S> none of my counsel<S>6098</S>: they despised<S>5006</S> all my reproof<S>8433</S>.
Therefore shall they eat<S>398</S> of the fruit<S>6529</S> of their own way<S>1870</S>, and be filled<S>7646</S> with their own devices<S>4156</S>.
For the turning away<S>4878</S> of the simple<S>6612</S> shall slay<S>2026</S> them, and the prosperity<S>7962</S> of fools<S>3684</S> shall destroy<S>6</S> them. <sup>turning: or, ease of the simple</sup>
But whoso hearkeneth<S>8085</S> unto me shall dwell<S>7931</S> safely<S>983</S>, and shall be quiet<S>7599</S> from fear<S>6343</S> of evil<S>7451</S>.
